NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Meat and Distribution or the cell corresponding to Processed Foods and Imports?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Processed Foods} and {Imports} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Snacks and Innovation or the cell corresponding to Processed Foods and Sustainability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Snacks} and {Innovation} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Dairy and Exports or the cell corresponding to Snacks and Innovation?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Dairy} and {Exports} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.52 to 0.53?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Processed Foods, Consumption), (Produce, Distribution), (Snacks, Distribution), (Bakery, Exports), (Produce, Exports), (Snacks, Exports), (Bakery, Imports), (Confectionery, Imports), (Processed Foods, Imports), (Confectionery, Innovation), (Meat, Innovation), (Produce, Innovation), (Snacks, Innovation), (Bakery, Marketing), (Dairy, Marketing), (Produce, Marketing), (Processed Foods, Prices), (Snacks, Prices), (Bakery, Safety), (Confectionery, Safety), (Ingredients, Safety), (Snacks, Safety)}.
